```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
sf <- 3 # number of significant figures to use
v <- signif(runif(1, 1, 100), sf) # speed in m/s
t <- signif(runif(1, 1, 100), sf) # time in s

answer <- v*t
distractors <- c(v/t)
sc <- num_to_schoice(answer, wrong = distractors, delta = 0.1, range = c(min(v/t, t/v), 2*v*t), format = FALSE)

sc$questions <- sapply(sc$questions, signif, sf)
sc$questions <- sprintf("\\SI{%g}{m}", sc$questions)
```

Question
========
Suppose an object travels at a constant velocity of $\SI{`r v`}{m/s}$. What distance would it travel in $\SI{`r t`}{s}$?

```{r questionlist, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use the formula for constant velocity motion.

$$ d = vt = (\SI{`r v`}{m/s})(\SI{`r t`}{s}) = \SI{`r signif(v*t, 3)`}{m}$$
